description.raw:
Before this fix, I was getting

```shell
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package \
E: Unable to locate package \
E: Unable to locate package \
E: Unable to locate package \
```

when running `sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES)`. This pull request fixes that and also adds how to use \`GAZEBO\_MAJOR\_VERSION\`
description.html:
Before this fix, I was getting

title.raw: Fix script that installs dependencies from environment variables
